message: The bill would give sex-trafficking victims more power to sue websites that knowingly support sex trafficking. Supporters say the legislation will help curb the growing epidemic of online sex trafficking that often involves children, while opponents argue it could expose tech companies to costly lawsuits and infringe on free speech.

data.description: Bill is intended is to curb online sex trafficking by holding website operators more accountable for their users' activities.
data.title: Senate approves controversial online sex trafficking bill
